Key Match Events: DeMar DeRozan scored nine of Sacramento’s 11 points in the second overtime, leading the Kings to a 123-118 victory.
Domantas Sabonis had a triple-double with 21 points, 18 rebounds, and 11 assists.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. recorded a triple-double with 16 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists for Miami.
Tyler Herro was called for a costly 8-second violation toward the end of the fourth quarter.
The game was tied at 102 at the end of regulation and at 112 after the first overtime.
DeRozan hit a 3-pointer and a trio of step-back jumpers in the second overtime to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Heat coach Erik Spoelstra noted that his team played solid for the first four quarters but got sloppy in overtime.
Sacramento Kings are playing with more heart and effort under interim coach Doug Christie compared to the final two weeks under former coach Mike Brown.
Others: The Heat are 4-7 without Jimmy Butler this season.
The Kings extended their winning streak to a season-high five games.
